raw_data.context:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello. How's your week coming along?
User: It's great, thanks. I'm trying to learn how to make croissants.
System: Wow that's interesting. I have baked cookies, but croissants seem much more sophisticated. Did you make any progress?
User: I've done them once or twice so far, but they haven't been flakey enough. I'm trying to figure out why. What kind of cookies have you made?
System: Mint chocolate chips. I think your croissants not being flakey could have something to do with your oven's temperature.
User: Ah, good thought, thanks!
System: Have you thought about melting some chocolate into your croissants? They don't have to be something unhealthy. For example, melted dark chocolate is good for the heart, and makes the resulting croissants taste much better.
User: Now that is a good idea. I'll give it a try next time. Would you say you have a sweet tooth?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What's the strangest dream you've ever had?
User: All my dreams are strange. Well, at least, most of them are.
System: What about the ones that aren't strange?
User: Do you sometimes have dreams that are completely mundane? I do. Then I wake up and think "Oh, how disappointing."
System: Yeah. But at least it's not a nightmare.
User: Right, fair point, I should count my blessings.
System: Yep. It doesn't have to be a fun dream, just not a nightmare!
User: I suddenly feel I should ask: am I dreaming now?
System: Do you think you're dreaming?
User: I'm not sure. This could be one of my mundane dreams about everyday life.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How have you been
User: great! just came back from a ski trip
System: How was it? What trails did you ski on?
User: I slammed onto an ice wall, but I got better and turning after that haha
System: a resort in Montreal
User: Oh cool! do you know any french? I used to take french in high school but basically forgot most of it
System: Yeah I grew up speaking it. It's pretty much mandatory here
User: Did you go anywhere else in montreal?

Sample5:

Conversation History:

System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: I must do what the what now?
System: Right now?Why do you have to do it?
User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample7:

Conversation History:

System: You are who I want to talk with too.
User: Should I stop being lazy and go into work?
System: Trust your instincts.
User: My instincts say that it is cold outside, and the walk to work is far. My instincts rarely let me down. My instincts rarely let me down.
System: You just repeated yourself.
User: Yes, because you just asked me the same thing. My answer hasn't changed in the last minute.
System: That's not what I meant.
User: What exactly did you mean?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello, how is your day?
User: It's good. It's raining a bit, but I am enjoying a good book. How about you?
System: It's good, I just got back from walking my dog What book did you read?
User: I'm reading the Three Body Problem. Ever heard of it?
System: No, what is it about?
User: It's a sci-fi book about aliens and a type of virtual reality. Pique your interest at all?
System: Slightly, I typically read fiction but I can curious what type of virtual reality is discussed in the book
User: Cool. This virtual reality is a based on life on an alien planet. There is a twist though. Do you want me to spoil it for you?
System: Yes!
User: The virtual reality is actually based on a real alien civilization! And that civilization is coming to attack earth! dun dun dun dunnnnnnn

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you?
User: I'm doing great. what are you up to?
System: I was just reading a book actually How about you?
User: oh, I'm enjoying a sip of coffee, looking over the ocean. what book are you reading?
System: I'm reading Why We Sleep It's a book by a sleep scientist about the benefits of sleeping/cons of not sleeping enough I'm trying to scare myself into sleeping more haha
User: that seems like a good book. does it have good tips on how to sleep better?
System: I think so! I haven't finished it yet though Understanding sleep better has been helping me value it more and I've been sleeping a lot earlier Have you read any good books recently?
User: I read lots of papers, but do poorly on books :( a recent book that I like is Zero to One by Peter Thiel
System: What's the book about?
User: it's about startups, lots of useful principles and philosophies for innovation, like being a contrarian

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! What's up?
User: sky is up
System: No, it's night time.
User: so where does the sky go in the night?
System: It goes wherever it wants to.
User: that doesn't make sense. How can sky go anywhere?
System: It doesn't have to make sense.
User: why?
System: Because it doesn't have to.
User: you are very abstract. Something bothering you?
System: Nope. I'm fine.
User: You really don't seem so. You can tell me what's going on?
System: I'm just fine.
User: ok. wanna go out to eat dessert?
System: I'm not hungry.
User: Okay, I am heading out now
